selected_quotes: JAMA - Notice of Retraction: An article by Sato et al has been retracted. #health #research

citation.title:
Notice of Retraction: Sato Y, et al. The Prevention of Hip Fracture With Risedronate and Ergocalciferol Plus Calcium Supplementation in Elderly Women With Alzheimer Disease: A Randomized Controlled Trial.
              Arch Intern Med.
              2005;165(15):1737-1742.

news.title: Is Web-Based Test for Prediabetes Faulty?
news.summary: Assessment finds 8 in 10 Americans over 60 at risk, a conclusion questioned by several experts.

news.title: Some Increased Bleeding Risk Seen With Blood Thinner Xarelto Vs. Pradaxa
news.summary: But study wasn't definitive, and heart experts say both newer drugs are better than warfarin.

news.title: Some Increased Bleeding Risk Seen With Blood Thinner Xarelto Vs. Pradaxa
news.summary: MONDAY, Oct. 3, 2016 (HealthDay News) -- The blood thinner Xarelto may pose a slightly greater risk of serious bleeding than Pradaxa in patients with the abnormal heartbeat known as atrial fibrillation, new research suggests.

news.title: Is Web-Based Test for Prediabetes Faulty?
news.summary: MONDAY, Oct. 3, 2016 (HealthDay News) -- A simple, seven-question test for prediabetes may be needlessly sending millions of healthy Americans to their physicians for follow-up blood sugar testing, a new analysis suggests.

news.title: Statins associated with lower risk of cardiac events for some patients, not others
news.summary: Cholesterol-lowering statins were associated with lower risk for major cardiac events in some patients with preexisting ischemic heart disease but not in others, according to an article published online by JAMA Internal Medicine.

news.title: Just a Little of Statins' Effect Enough to Help Heart: Study
news.summary: (HealthDay News) -- Giving high doses of statins to patients with heart disease doesn't lower the risk of future heart trouble any more than moderate doses of the cholesterol-lowering drugs do, a new study finds.

news.title: Is Web-Based Test Labeling Too Many People With 'Prediabetes'?

news.title: CardioBrief: More Bleeds With Rivaroxaban in Real-World Comparison
news.summary: Patients who take rivaroxaban ( Xarelto ) may be more likely to have serious bleeding events than patients who take dabigatran ( Pradaxa ), an observational study found.

blogs.title: JAMA journals pull 3 papers by same authors for misconduct
blogs.summary: JAMA and another journal in its network have retracted three 2005 papers about preventing hip fractures, after an admission of scientific misconduct.  All papers are being retracted over concerns about data integrity, and “inappropriate assignme

blogs.title: Fraud by bone researcher takes down two meta-analyses, a clinical trial, and review
blogs.summary: The troubles continue for a bone researcher, who’s lost multiple papers in recent months due to problems ranging from data issues to including authors without their consent. Now, journals have retracted two more papers by Yoshihiro Sato. And in a sig

facebook.title: Notice of Retraction
facebook.summary: A rare retraction of articles purporting to show benefit of risedronate on hip fractures. How many other clinical trials were similarly tainted?
